content.description: The Falcon Guidebook lists this as the Turtle Proj, and says that it was awaiting a short and strong climber to send it. I, of course, found the weak tallboy beta for it and snagged the FA.Start with a perfect left heel-toe cam under the left face of the boulder, hands on two single pad 3 finger crimps that are right next to each other, and a right foot somewhere on the rail at the base of the boulder. Pull off and power up to a bad right hand pinch with a sharp thumb catch, then left hand to a blocky pinch below the lip of the boulder. Throw for an incut crimp on the face, then get to the jugs above and top out. Left face is off other than the starting foot.One of the higher quality moderate boulders you're likely to find on this type of rock.
content.protection: A pad below and maybe one on the rock behind you.
content.location: Walk to the Turtle Back Rock formation from the nearby parking lot, then go down a gulley on the left side. This is on the 2nd overhanging boulder, behind the first one you see down the slope.

content.description:
L->R 

  V0:left aspect following arête to middle and up   V2:left traverse to middle aspect straight to horn and top out   V1:traverse left to right and top out right   V3:begin on bad joint, finish on 23   22.bad joint V4:sit down start with double on flat jug on left edge of triangle face. Low-traverse right to stance just past right edge, then reverse to starting jug and top out.   V0:right aspect staying to right of horn and top out   23. V2:right traverse left to middle aspect and top out at horn.   V1: right to left traverse top out left following arête
THE WORLD RESTS ON THE BACK OF A TURTLE. USE NEW JERSEY FALCON GUIDE.
